events.text: You and Juan manage to get the Professor to at least look like he’s a worker on the cargo ship well enough not to be ousted.
Some captains have horrible punishments for stowaways–Juan cheerily told you all the stories he’d heard and experienced on his own journey to Hawaii.
Delightful.
The cargo boat finally lands in Tokyo after a long trip, and the three of you–plus Soot tucked in your shirt–discreetly enter Tokyo.
The city is bigger than you had imagined. There are street cars and trams, people walking to and fro everywhere. You feel like you can get lost.
We’ve definitely lost the Mafia now.
Indeed, my boy!
The Professor is as chipper as ever.
Meow.
Your stomach grumbles.
Let’s drop by a restaurant!
Nice! Where to? Japan’s known for ramen, sushi… and fish. Well, I don’t know much about Japanese cuisine.
He drapes an arm over your shoulder.

events.choice: Any grub is fine by me!

events.text: Juan smiles.
Then… let’s go there!
Noodles! Nice.
Fish? I’m down. I’ve had plenty of sushi in Hawaii, I can even give you pointers about Hawaiian customs!
Together, hand in hand, you all head to the restaurant you had decided on together, passing through sheets of cloth to enter the warm, cozy restaurant.
Juan holds three fingers up.
Table for three please!
You are all quickly ushered to a nearby table, sitting next to Juan while the Professor slides into the seat across from you two.
You look at the menu placed before you and don’t understand the Japanese at all. There are small, English words below the pictures, which helps a lot.
You notice this restaurant sells ramen, fish, and everything in between. You see a lot of food you’re unfamiliar with, but the pictures look appetizing.
Juan is also squinting at the menu.
Meow.
The Professor adjusts his glasses and reads the menu himself, being the only person fluent in Japanese.

events.question: Welcome to our restaurant. Are you ready to order?

events.text: I’ll have the same.
The Professor clears his throat and starts speaking to the waitress in Japanese. They speak together for a while, and both of them laugh after a few exchanges.
You notice her body language is less tense, more relaxed now.
Juan leans forward after she leaves.
What did you talk about?
Oh nothing! I simply complimented the color palette of her restaurant and asked her where she learned English–which is very good, I tell you what–and she was complimenting my Japanese as well!
I told her I’m from the United States and am traveling to Tibet to research a sacred valley!
She told me that she inherited this small shop from her late grandfather–bless him–and she’s running it all on her own! What a respectable young woman!
I asked her about how Japan is nowadays, the politics–did you know just last year there was an attempted coup?–and then–
Profe, haven’t you learned? Stop telling others you’re trying to find Shangri-La!
It’s not Shangri-La, Juan!! It’s a beyul!!!! Shangri-La was made up by that hack James Hilton! It’s a beyul, Juan, a beyul–
Alright, alright, sheesh! Sorry, Profe!
It takes a while for your food to arrive–the young woman really was running the shop all on her own.
But when your food arrives, it’s fresh and beautifully presented.

events.question: The Professor amicably chats with the shopkeeper as she places the food on your table, before she leaves you to yourselves.

events.text: The Professor gladly speaks to fill in the silence.
Delicious! You have good taste, [YOUR NAME].
Now that we’re in Japan, I want to look for the Temple of Bishamon! Perhaps after paying our respects, we will be blessed on our journey to the beyul!
Bisha… mon? Why specifically that deity?
Ah, I told you all about my research on the ride here, Juan. Remember?
Juan scratches the back of his head.
Sorry, Profe. It’s just… you tend to info dump and it’s hard to remember everything you said.
I attest to that.
Then I shall remind you!

events.question: Bishamon is another name for Sha Wujing, who we know as Sandy from the [i]Journey to the West[/i]. [YOUR NAME], do you remember what I taught you about him?

events.text: You vaguely know that Sandy is the calmest and clearest-headed of the group consisting of Sun Wukong, Tripitaka, Pigsy, and the White Dragon Horse.
Well, aside from Tripitaka and the White Dragon Horse.
You remember a lot about Sandy, but not everything. He was the calmest of the group consisting of Sun Wukong, Tripitaka, Pigsy, and the White Dragon Horse.
Well, aside from Tripitaka and the White Dragon Horse.
He tried to eat Tripitaka by leaping out of the Liusha river, but Sun Wukong stopped him and he joined the Journey to the West.
Apparently, he was originally from the heavens, but was turned into a man-eating demon as punishment, before he became Sandy.
The Professor does info dump a lot, so your memories of Sandy’s role in the story is vague. He was the calmest and clearest-headed of the group, aside from Tripitaka, the monk.
Sandy is also known as Sha Wujing, and the Japanese god of fortune: Bishamon. We can learn much about him by visiting a temple dedicated to him.
Since my research involves the [i]Journey to the West[/i] and the beyuls, it is likely he himself is connected to these sacred valleys. Let’s go!
After you finish your meal, you head off to the Temple for Bishamon.
As you walk together to the temple, you notice the Professor checking his inner coat pocket often. It must be that amulet he’s so protective of. Why?
As you enter the Temple for Bishamon, you see a statue of a figure dominating the center.
The most interesting part was the staff which rested upon his shoulder; crescent shaped on one end and fan shaped on the other.
You wander the temple, examining the illustrations pasted on the walls and the artifacts laid out on the counters.
Behind the statue is a peculiar illustration depicting a figure much like the statue, except his skin was blue and nine skulls hung around his neck. He appeared much more fearsome than the statue.
As you are exploring the temple, Juan comes up behind you to look over your shoulder.

events.question: The hum he lets out leads you to believe his interest is feigned, but nonetheless, his presence is reassuring.

events.choice: “What do you think of this temple, Juan?”

events.text: It’s quite nice, even though I don’t really understand the stories behind everything.
Hmm, the closest thing I have in comparison are the Catholic churches back home. The mood is very different. This place feels… spiritual.
Yeah. It’s as if there’s…
You can’t quite put a finger on the feeling.
As if…
This place feels… spiritual.
Yeah. It’s as if there’s…
You can’t quite put a finger on the feeling.
As if…
Juan tilts his head at you.
What do you mean?
The religious tones of this temple reminds me of home.
Really? How so?
My father was a pastor, so I would go to church every Sunday. There, religion felt like a duty. Here, however… feels spiritual. As if…
As if there’s magic in the air?
You nod.
Yes, exactly. Magic. As if some deity is here with us.
The Professor joins the two of you in examining the illustration and statue.
So you’re saying this, became this?
You watch Juan point between the illustration of the horrifying demon, and the statue in the center of the temple.
The Prof nods energetically.
Originally from the heavens, he was turned into a man-eating demon when he accidentally destroyed the Jade Emperor’s vase in anger.
Suddenly, you hear someone clearing their throat gently, and all three of you turn towards the sound.
Apologies for my intrusion, but I think it’s about time I clarified: it was no accident.
You stare at the newcomer, thinking he looks oddly familiar.
But you are–!
He exclaims and points again between the statue, illustration, and this time, the man as well.
You take a closer look at the man, and notice the telling staff in his hand.
‘Sandy’ chuckles softly, running a hand over his thick beard and nodding slowly.
The professor is practically jumping on the balls of his feet.
If you really are, then you must know about this!
Quickly, he pulls his amulet out of his coat and holds it in front of Sandy's face.
The moment he does so, the amulet starts to glow, getting brighter with every passing second.
You see Sandy’s mouth fall slightly open.
He looks as if he’s about to speak, but a shout from the entrance of the temple has you all frozen for a moment.
You are under arrest! Get down on your knees and drop the amulet!
You exchange glances with the others, and Sandy speaks first.
There is an exit in the back, hurry!
You can’t understand why he sounds so panicked, but your instincts tell you not to question his intentions.
The three of you stumble around the displays and behind a wall just as a loud bang resonates in the air.
There is a metal clang, before the bangs come more rapidly. Realizing that it is gunfire, the three of you begin to make your way out of the temple with haste.
Despite the franticness of everything, you can’t help but wonder: [i]what is going on?[/i]
